alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued December 15 at 2:55PM EST until December 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST FRIDAY... ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM SATURDAY TO 7 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy, wet snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches, with the greatest amounts across the higher terrain of the Tug Hill and western foothills of the Adirondacks. For the Lake Effect Snow Warning, heavy lake effect snow expected. Total lake effect snow accumulations of 2 to 3 feet in the most persistent lake snows across the Tug Hill Plateau. * WHERE...The Eastern Lake Ontario Region. The heaviest snowfall is expected across the higher terrain of the Tug Hill Plateau. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 PM EST Friday. For the Lake Effect Snow Warning, from 1 AM Saturday to 7 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible at times with very poor visibility and deep snow cover on roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. Experimental content below...do not use operationally To view the experimental polygons please see: http://www.weather.gov/buf/lespolygon COORD...4372 7541 4389 7558 4392 7581 4390 7606 4385 7629 4374 7625 4350 7623 4346 7581 4346 7561 4353 7545 TIME Y22M12D17T0600Z-Y22M12D18T0000Z COORD...4387 7522 4397 7530 4400 7583 4393 7636 4363 7623 4351 7629 4345 7570 4345 7555 4363 7542 4373 7526 TIME Y22M12D18T0000Z-Y22M12D18T1800Z COORD...4366 7527 4370 7544 4387 7556 4388 7586 4374 7628 4359 7625 4345 7656 4338 7590 4348 7581 4347 7548 TIME Y22M12D18T1800Z-Y22M12D19T0600Z COORD...4360 7513 4371 7511 4372 7538 4381 7569 4367 7623 4354 7645 4343 7640 4329 7591 4348 7581 4342 7550 TIME Y22M12D19T0600Z-Y22M12D20T0000Z
info.instruction: Widespread accumulating snow and ice will create dangerous travel conditions. Submit snow and ice reports through our website or social media. Heavy snow will fall in relatively narrow bands. If traveling, be prepared for rapidly changing road conditions and visibilities. Submit snow reports through our website or social media.
